title: 一群M+ 博物館員工響應八月五日聯合罷工聲明

replies.msg:
[一群M+ 博物館員工響應八月五日聯合罷工聲明]
作為博物館工作者，我們客觀分析及闡述文化藝術，深信博物館在接納社會不同觀點與聲音的同時，亦肩負社會責任。政府漠視民意，強推逃犯條例修訂，引發一連串政治衝突。自六月以來，政府無視社會不公、縱容警察濫權及濫暴、漠視黑社會侵犯市民人身安全、政治檢控示威者等。我們有感法治及公義逐漸瓦解，人權與自由被剝削，創作受到不同程度的限制。M+ 作為一所立足香港的博物館，矢志展示及保存視覺文化，以反映當下的文化面貌，不能只考慮部份持份者的立場，忘卻我們最根本的責任。 因此，我們決定於八月五日響應全城罷工，堅決守護作為文化藝術工作者的價值、自由及社會責任。

我們在此向政府重申以下訴求：
1. 徹底撤回逃犯條例修訂；
2. 撤回相關示威行動的暴動定性；
3. 永久撤銷對所有相關示威者的不合理控罪；
4. 成立獨立調查委員會，包括調查警察濫權濫暴（特別是721元朗黑社會襲擊事件上的失職）；
5. 立即實行雙普選

一群響應罷工行動的M+ 博物館員工
（暫佔總員工人數三分一）



[A Joint Statement from a Group of M+ Staff in Support of the Citywide Strike on 5 August]

Working for M+, we firmly believe that museums have the obligation to fulfil their social responsibilities. While museums should remain unbiased in their interpretation and presentation of art and culture, they should also embrace different perspectives and voices in the society. The HKSAR government, despite polarising views, tried to hasten the passing of the extradition bill, resulting in a series of socio-political conflicts over the past few months. Since June, it has turned a blind eye to the injustices suffered by the citizens, including Hong Kong police’s abusive violence against demonstrators and the violent mob attack in Yuen Long. Worst of all, the government has laid unreasonable political charges against the arrested protesters. In response to these events, we feel that the rule of law, justice, human rights, and freedom have been infringed upon, and it has become increasingly difficult to exercise creative autonomy. As a museum rooted in Hong Kong, M+ aims to reflect contemporary culture through presentation and preservation of visual culture. We should not only consider the stances of particular stakeholders nor lose sight of our fundamental responsibilities. Hence, we have decided to join the citywide strike on 5 Aug 2019. We stand firm behind the values, freedom and social responsibilities that we uphold as arts and culture practitioners.

We hereby reiterate the following demands to the HKSAR government:
1. Withdraw the extradition bill entirely
2. Retract the ‘riot’ classification of relevant demonstrations
3. Drop all unreasonable charges against the arrested protesters permanently
4. Set up an independent commission to investigate police misconduct and abuse of power (including the police misconduct on the 721 Yuen Long mob attack)
5. Immediately implement universal suffrage

A group of M+ staff in support of the citywide strike on 5 August
(Currently at 1/3 of all staff)
